mozilla.components.browser.toolbar

Class BrowserToolbar

  • mozilla.components.browser.toolbar.BrowserToolbar

  • public class BrowserToolbar

    A customizable toolbar for browsers.

    The toolbar can switch between two modes: display and edit. The display mode displays the current URL and controls for navigation. In edit mode the current URL can be edited. Those two modes are implemented by the DisplayToolbar and EditToolbar classes.

        +----------------+
    | BrowserToolbar |
    +--------+-------+
             +
     +-------+-------+
     |               |

    +---------v------+ +-------v--------+ | DisplayToolbar | | EditToolbar | +----------------+ +----------------+

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  BrowserToolbar.Button
      An action button to be added to the toolbar.
      static class  BrowserToolbar.Companion 
      static class  BrowserToolbar.ToggleButton
      An action button with two states, selected and unselected. When the button is pressed, the state changes automatically.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addBrowserAction(mozilla.components.concept.toolbar.Toolbar.Action action)
      Adds an action to be displayed on the right side of the toolbar (outside of the URL bounding box) in display mode.
      void addNavigationAction(mozilla.components.concept.toolbar.Toolbar.Action action)
      Adds an action to be display on the far left side of the toolbar. This area is usually used on larger devices for navigation actions like "back" and "forward".
      void addPageAction(mozilla.components.concept.toolbar.Toolbar.Action action)
      Adds an action to be displayed on the right side of the URL in display mode.
      void displayMode()
      Switches to URL displaying mode.
      void displayProgress(int progress) 
      void editMode()
      Switches to URL editing mode.
      int getBrowserActionMargin()
      Gets/Sets the margin to be used between browser actions.
      boolean getDisplaySiteSecurityIcon()
      Set/Get whether a site security icon (usually a lock or globe icon) should be next to the URL.
      java.lang.String getHint()
      Sets the text to be displayed when the URL of the toolbar is empty.
      kotlin.jvm.functions.Function0<java.lang.Boolean> getOnUrlClicked()
      Sets a lambda that will be invoked whenever the URL in display mode was clicked. Only if this lambda returns true the toolbar will switch to editing mode. Return false to not switch to editing mode and handle the click manually.
      java.lang.String getUrl() 
      int getUrlBoxMargin()
      Gets/Sets horizontal margin of the URL box (surrounding URL and page actions) in display mode.

      Gets/Sets a custom view that will be drawn as behind the URL and page actions in display mode.

      Sets autocomplete filter to be used in edit mode.

      void setMenuBuilder(mozilla.components.browser.menu.BrowserMenuBuilder menuBuilder)
      Sets a BrowserMenuBuilder that will be used to create a menu when the menu button is clicked. The menu button will only be visible if a builder has been set.

      Sets a listener to be invoked when focus of the URL input view (in edit mode) changed.
      void setOnUrlClicked(kotlin.jvm.functions.Function0<java.lang.Boolean> value)

        public BrowserToolbar(android.content.Context context,
                      android.util.AttributeSet attrs,
                      int defStyleAttr)

        A customizable toolbar for browsers.

        The toolbar can switch between two modes: display and edit. The display mode displays the current URL and controls for navigation. In edit mode the current URL can be edited. Those two modes are implemented by the DisplayToolbar and EditToolbar classes.

      • getOnUrlClicked

        public kotlin.jvm.functions.Function0<java.lang.Boolean> getOnUrlClicked()

        Sets a lambda that will be invoked whenever the URL in display mode was clicked. Only if this lambda returns true the toolbar will switch to editing mode. Return false to not switch to editing mode and handle the click manually.

      • setOnUrlClicked

        public void setOnUrlClicked(kotlin.jvm.functions.Function0<java.lang.Boolean> value)

        Sets a lambda that will be invoked whenever the URL in display mode was clicked. Only if this lambda returns true the toolbar will switch to editing mode. Return false to not switch to editing mode and handle the click manually.

      • invalidateActions

        public void invalidateActions()

        Declare that the actions (navigation actions, browser actions, page actions) have changed and should be updated if needed.

        The toolbar will call the visible lambda of every action to determine whether a view for this action should be added or removed. Additionally bind will be called on every visible action to update its view.

      • addBrowserAction

        public void addBrowserAction(mozilla.components.concept.toolbar.Toolbar.Action action)

        Adds an action to be displayed on the right side of the toolbar (outside of the URL bounding box) in display mode.

        If there is not enough room to show all icons then some icons may be moved to an overflow menu.

        Related: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/Add-ons/WebExtensions/user_interface/Browser_action

      • addPageAction

        public void addPageAction(mozilla.components.concept.toolbar.Toolbar.Action action)

        Adds an action to be displayed on the right side of the URL in display mode.

        Related: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/Add-ons/WebExtensions/user_interface/Page_actions

      • addNavigationAction

        public void addNavigationAction(mozilla.components.concept.toolbar.Toolbar.Action action)

        Adds an action to be display on the far left side of the toolbar. This area is usually used on larger devices for navigation actions like "back" and "forward".

      • editMode

        public void editMode()

        Switches to URL editing mode.

      • displayMode

        public void displayMode()

        Switches to URL displaying mode.

      • setMenuBuilder

        public void setMenuBuilder(mozilla.components.browser.menu.BrowserMenuBuilder menuBuilder)

        Sets a BrowserMenuBuilder that will be used to create a menu when the menu button is clicked. The menu button will only be visible if a builder has been set.
